captions.text: If you go through the stats, in the Premier League, quite a few teams, especially in the top in 6 have scored 50/60% of their goals through set pieces.
Some of them being direct free kicks, so it's important that we work on these things. It's all about finding those small margins to get the 3 points.
The first free kick we're going to do, we're looking at probably 25 yards out.
The thing you need to consider when you're looking at it is the position of the goalkeeper.
So left footer here, and right footer there. Straight away you're causing the goalkeeper a problem,
because he's not sure who is going to take this. Will the wall jump? Or will it just stand?
If you know it's a wall that jumps then you might drill a low shot that goes through.
The wall has done its job. Have a little look like you're going to whip it over the top. He's going to think you're curling it there.
And if you see him starting to edge, then you might pick his side.
Obviously, its important that there is a variation so it becomes unpredictable.
Try start it just outside of the post, horrible for a goalkeeper. Brilliant!
Great free-kick! You can't do much about that.
So you've done the whip over the wall, you've done the whip that side. Let's go for the power strike now.
I want you to lace it, head down, toe down, an absolute power strike.
There's going to be so much traffic, just a shot on target, a really hard effort through there is horrible.
The likes of Ronaldo and Drogba, they've all developed their own techniques. Can I put the valve this way, or raise the ball higher.
All these little things can affect the flight of the ball and can make it very difficult for a goalkeeper.
This is a free-kick from right on the edge of the box, near enough a penalty.
Very important that both of you are looking interested. Maybe have a little talk, anything that can get into his head.
Trust me, because it's a closer distance, goalkeepers and defenders hate free-kicks in this situation.
You don't need to go with that much pace, its more about accuracy. So if you can hit anything in that area, leaving the goalkeeper,
he's really going to struggle. Because that is a long way. That's the one!
Its mainly you against that wall and the keeper and its about you trying to assess and recognize any weaknesses within the opposition,
which might give you the chance to score the goal you need
to get the three points which are obviously so important, especially in the last stages of the season.
